document_data.caption: A map of the Ice Lakes, showing their location in [[northwest Faerûn]].
document_data.name: Ice Lakes
document_data.title: Questions for Ed Greenwood (2013)
document_data.author: The Hooded One
document_data.mainbody:
;[[Belardym]]: Also known as Tynkur's Fist.
;[[Rarghraum]]: The largest lake, also known as Ondran's Grave.
;[[Loroloth]]: A lake that bore several islands, also known as Daern's Copper Camp.
;[[Antaerth]]: The southernmost lake, also known as Saeriphahra's Mirror.

Geography.Derthym:
The northernmost named lake, also known as Longknife Lake.{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum

Geography.Rarghraum: The largest lake, also known as Ondran's Grave.
Geography.Loroloth: A lake that bore several islands, also known as Daern's Copper Camp.
Geography.Antaerth: The southernmost lake, also known as Saeriphahra's Mirror.

document_data.Government: The [[Waterdeep|Waterdhavian]] [[Nobility of Waterdeep|noble house]] [[Majarra]] owned land by the Ice Lakes. Starting in {{Yearlink|1360}}, the property was overseen by [[Axor Majarra]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1046}}, [[Illusk]] sent out a garrison to wipe out the local [[kobold]]s, but this campaign was repelled.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The presence of [[ice serpent]]s in the North was rumored to be the doing of an [[Akadi]]an [[cleric]] dwelling somewhere around the Ice Lakes.
document_data.Inhabitants: The kobold tribe known as the [[Selgryn]] inhabited the area.{{Cite dragon/216/Elminster's Notebook: Kobold commotions}}
